1.1.1.title: Purpose
1.1.1.content:
This Well Control Manual establishes the minimum requirements, procedures, and standards for well control operations. It provides a comprehensive framework to:

- Prevent well control incidents through proper planning, training, and execution
- Ensure rapid and effective response when well control events occur
- Protect personnel safety as the primary priority
- Minimize environmental impact
- Protect company and client assets

This manual applies to all drilling, completion, workover, and well intervention operations.

1.1.2.title: Scope
1.1.2.content:
This manual covers:

- Well control philosophy and barrier requirements
- Organizational roles and responsibilities
- Personnel competency and certification requirements
- Well control procedures for all operational phases
- Equipment specifications and testing requirements
- Special operations (HPHT, MPD, deepwater, well intervention)
- Emergency response procedures
- Calculations, worksheets, and quick reference materials

This manual is structured in four volumes for ease of use and maintenance.

1.1.3.title: Document Structure
1.1.3.content:
The Well Control Manual comprises four volumes:

**Volume 1: Policy & People**
Well control philosophy, barrier requirements, organizational structure, roles and responsibilities, certifications, training, and human factors.

**Volume 2: Procedures**
Operational procedures for kick prevention, detection, shut-in, kill operations, and special operations including HPHT, deepwater, MPD, and well intervention.

**Volume 3: Equipment & Testing**
Equipment specifications, testing requirements, and rig-specific procedures. Includes customizable templates for different rigs/vessels.

**Volume 4: Calculations & Quick Reference**
Formulas, kill sheets, worksheets, decision trees, and quick reference cards for rig floor use.

1.1.4.title: Document Control
1.1.4.content:
This is a controlled document. The current revision is maintained in the document management system.

**Revision Process:**
- Revisions may be initiated by any personnel through the Management of Change process
- All revisions require review by qualified Well Control personnel
- Approved revisions are distributed through controlled channels
- Superseded versions shall be removed from use

**Uncontrolled Copies:**
Printed copies and local downloads are uncontrolled. Users must verify they have the current revision before use.

**Review Frequency:**
This manual shall be reviewed at minimum annually, or when:
- Regulatory requirements change
- Significant incidents occur
- Equipment or procedures are modified
- Industry best practices evolve

1.1.5.title: Language Conventions
1.1.5.content:
The following terms have specific meanings throughout this manual:

**SHALL / MUST**
Mandatory requirement. Non-compliance requires formal deviation approval.

**SHOULD**
Recommended practice. Deviation permitted with documented justification.

**MAY**
Optional guidance. Use is at the discretion of responsible personnel.

**WILL**
Statement of intent or expectation.

1.1.6.title: Deviation from Procedures
1.1.6.content:
Deviations from mandatory requirements (SHALL/MUST) require:

1. Written deviation request documenting:
   - Specific requirement to be deviated from
   - Reason for deviation
   - Proposed alternative measures
   - Risk assessment
   - Duration of deviation

2. Approval from appropriate authority level:
   - Minor deviations: Operations Manager
   - Significant deviations: Asset Manager or equivalent
   - Safety-critical deviations: Corporate Well Control authority

3. Documentation retained for audit purposes

**Note:** In emergency situations where immediate action is required to protect life or prevent escalation, personnel may deviate as necessary. All emergency deviations shall be documented and reviewed as soon as practicable.

1.1.7.title: References
1.1.7.content:
This manual incorporates requirements from:

**International Standards:**
- API RP 53 - Blowout Prevention Equipment Systems
- API RP 59 - Well Control Operations
- API Standard 53 - BOP Equipment Systems for Drilling Wells
- API 16D - Control Systems for Drilling Well Control Equipment
- ISO 10417 - Subsurface Safety Valve Systems
- NORSOK D-010 - Well Integrity in Drilling and Well Operations

**Industry Bodies:**
- IWCF (International Well Control Forum)
- IADC (International Association of Drilling Contractors)

**Regulatory Requirements:**
Applicable local regulations as identified in the Well Control Response Plan (Bridging Document) for each operation.
